00055 /**
00056  * @def TRIGGER_LED_TX
00057  * @brief LED 0 is used for tx event indication.

00060  * by UpdateLEDs();
00061  */

00064 #   define TRIGGER_LED_TX(); { txLED = hwclock () + LED_DELAY; LED_TX(LED_ON); }
00065 #else
00066 #   define TRIGGER_LED_TX();        {}
00067 #endif

00112 /**
00113  * @def UpdateLEDs
00114  * @brief supervise the traffic LEDs.
00115  *
00116  * This define the supervisary timer to switch the traffic LEDs off automatically.
00117  */
00118 /****************************************************************************/
00119 void UpdateLEDs (void)
00120 /****************************************************************************/
00121 {
00122     unsigned long tiStamp;
00123     tiStamp = hwclock ();
00124 
00125 #   ifdef CONFIG_USE_TX_LED
00126     if (txLED < tiStamp)
00127     {
00128         LED_TX(LED_OFF);
00129     }
00130 #   endif
00131 #   ifdef CONFIG_USE_RX_LED
00132     if (rxLED < tiStamp)
00133     {
00134         LED_RX(LED_OFF);
00135     }
00136 #   endif
00137 #   ifdef CONFIG_USE_ERR_LED
00138     if (errLED < tiStamp)
00139     {
00140         LED_ERR(LED_OFF);
00141     }
00142 #   endif
00143 
00144 #   ifdef CONFIG_USE_CAL_LED
00145     if (calLED < tiStamp)
00146     {
00147         LED_CAL(LED_OFF);
00148     }
00149 #   endif
00150 }
00151 #else
00152 #   define TRIGGER_LED_TX();
00153 #   define TRIGGER_LED_RX();
00154 #   define TRIGGER_LED_ERR();
00155 #   define TRIGGER_LED_CAL();
00156 #   define UpdateLEDs();
00157 #endif /* CONFIG_TRAFFIC_LED */

00164  *  Local stuff

00166 MsgT        upMsg;                  /**< message struct for all received data. */
00167 int16_t     rcwd = 0;               /**< retransmission counter for dynamic recalibration. */
00168 uint32_t    tiRecal;                /**< timestamp of last calibration. */
00169 uint32_t    tiPhyRxTimeout;         /**< timestamp of last rx. */
00170 bool_t      tiPhyRxTimeout_once;    /**< report only once time */
00171 uint8_t     lastArqCount;           /**< number of retransmissions of last transmitted message. */
00172 MsgT        *txSendMsg = NULL;      /**< pointer to store last transmitted message. */
00173 bool_t      trxPollMode = TRUE;     /**< flag for irq polling. */
00174 uint8_t     buffSwapped = FALSE;    /**< swap buffer state for accessing the right memory block */
00175 AddrT       cacheAddr;              /**< destination address */
00176 AddrT       brdcAddr = PHY_BRDC_ADDR;   /**< broadcast address */
00177 uint8_t     last_frameType;         /**< last frameType */
00178 volatile uint8_t txIrq;             /**< tx interrupt status register. */
00179 volatile uint8_t rxIrq;             /**< rx interrupt status register. */

00181 /** @brief structure for all layer configuration settings  */
00182 PhyPIB phyPIB;
00183 
00184 /**
00185  * @brief Initializing of module global variables.
00186  *
00187  * This function initializes all module global variables located in the
00188  * physical layers parameter information base (phyPIB). The nanoLOC chip
00189  * has to be already initialized and in ready (idle) mode. The receiver is started
00190  * and interrupts for CRC2 and Tx End and Rx End are enabled.
00191  *
00192  */
00193 /****************************************************************************/
00194 void PHYInit (void)
00195 /****************************************************************************/
00196 {
00197     phyPIB.currentChannel   = PHY_CHANNEL_MIN;
00198     phyPIB.CAMode           = PHY_CCA_MODE_DEFAULT;
00199     phyPIB.titxstart        = 0;
00200     phyPIB.rxState          = PHY_TRX_OFF;
00201     phyPIB.rxOn             = FALSE;
00202     phyPIB.txPower          = 0x3f;
00203     phyPIB.pwrDownMode      = 2;
00204     txSendMsg               = NULL;
00205     phyPIB.recalInterval    = CONFIG_NTRX_RECAL_DELAY;
00206     phyPIB.phyRxTimeout     = CONFIG_NTRX_PHY_RX_TIMEOUT;
00207     tiPhyRxTimeout          = hwclock() + phyPIB.phyRxTimeout;
00208     tiPhyRxTimeout_once     = FALSE;
00209     phyPIB.arqMax           = CONFIG_MAX_ARQ;
00210     phyPIB.testmode         = 0;
00211     phyPIB.fec              = FALSE;
00212     phyPIB.frameType        = last_frameType = PHY_FRAME_TYPE_DATA;
00213     phyPIB.ant              = 0;
00214     trxPollMode             = TRUE;
00215     buffSwapped             = FALSE;
00216     /*
00217     * Clear and reset all interrupt flags of the nanoLOC chip
00218     */
00219     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxIntsReset_O] = 0x3f;
00220     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxIntsReset_O] = 0x7f;
00221     /*
00222      * enable tx and rx interrupts
00223      */
00224     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxIrqEnable_O] |= ((1 << NA_RxIrqEnable_B) | (1 << NA_TxIrqEnable_B));
00225 
00226     NTRXResetSettings ();
00227 
00228     /*
00229      * enable CRC checks on received messages. This will cause corrupt frames to be droped
00230      * silently by the nanoLOC chip. The receiver is restarted automatically.
00231      */
00232     if ((ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxCrc2Mode_O] & (1<< NA_RxCrc2Mode_B)) !=  0)
00233     {
00234         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxIntsEn_O] = (0x01 << NA_RxEnd_B);
00235     }
00236     else
00237     {
00238         ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxIntsEn_O] = ((0x01 << NA_RxEnd_B) | (0x01 << NA_RxOverflow_B));
00239     }
00240     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxIntsEn_O] = (1 << NA_TxEnd_B);
00241 
00242     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_RxIrqEnable_O, ntrxShadowReg + 0x0f, 6);
00243     /*
00244      * initialize layer global variables
00245      */
00246     txIrqStatus = 0;
00247     rxIrqStatus = 0;
00248     txIrq = 0;
00249     rxIrq = 0;
00250     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxIntsReset_O] = 0;
00251     ntrxShadowReg[NA_RxIntsReset_O] = 0;
00252 
00253     /*
00254      * start the receiver of the TRX chip
00255      */
00256     if (phyPIB.rxState == PHY_RX_ON)
00257     {
00258         NTRXRXEnable(TRUE);
00259     }
00260 
00261     ntrxState    = TxIDLE;
00262 
00263     NTRXRangingInit();
00264 #   ifdef CONFIG_NTRX_IRQ
00265     NTRXIrqEnable( TRUE );
00266 #   endif /* CONFIG_NTRX_IRQ */
00267 }
00268 
00269 /**
00270  * @brief This function send packets out.
00271  * @param *msg this is the message pointer
00272  *
00273  * This function is called ever on sending packets (e.g. PDSap).
00274  *
00275  */
00276 /****************************************************************************/
00277 void NTRXSendPacket (MsgT *msg)
00278 /****************************************************************************/
00279 {
00280     uint8_t txLen[2];
00281 
00282     /* if ntrx is in sleep mode, dont use ntrx */
00283     if (phyPIB.pwrDown == TRUE) return;
00284 
00285 #   ifdef CONFIG_NTRX_AUTO_RECALIB
00286     if (phyPIB.recalInterval != 0)
00287     {
00288         if( tiRecal < hwclock() )
00289         {
00290             /* INFO: If the TRX sends a packet, calibration failes!
00291                 * In this case rcwd is not reset, but tiRecal is.
00292                 */
00293             /* normal operation mode */
00294             if (phyPIB.testmode == 0)
00295             {
00296                 if (NTRXAllCalibration ())
00297                 {
00298                     tiRecal = hwclock() + phyPIB.recalInterval;
00299                     rcwd = 0;
00300                     TRIGGER_LED_CAL();
00301                 }
00302             }
00303         }
00304     }
00305 #   endif /* CONFIG_NTRX_AUTO_RECALIB */
00306 
00307     /* only messages with payload > 0 allowed, PDSap allready cover this! */
00308     if (msg->len == 0) return;
00309 
00310     /* check which buffer is free to transmit data */
00311     if (buffSwapped == TRUE)
00312     {
00313         /* write user data to transmit buffer in ntrx chip */
00314         NTRXSetIndexReg (2);
00315         NTRXSPIWrite ((uint8_t)(NA_RamTxBuffer_O & 0xff), msg->data, (uint8_t)(msg->len & 0xff));
00316 
00317     }else
00318     {
00319         /* write user data to transmit buffer in ntrx chip */
00320         NTRXSetIndexReg (3);
00321         NTRXSPIWrite ((uint8_t)(NA_RamTxBuffer_O & 0xff), msg->data, (uint8_t)(msg->len & 0xff));
00322     }
00323 
00324     NTRXSetIndexReg (0);
00325 
00326     memcpy (cacheAddr, msg->addr, 6);
00327     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_RamTxDstAddr_O, cacheAddr, 6);
00328 
00329     /*switch frametype: unicast / broadcast*/
00330     if ( ( (memcmp (brdcAddr, msg->addr, 6) == 0) && (phyPIB.frameType == PHY_FRAME_TYPE_DATA) ) )
00331     {
00332         last_frameType = phyPIB.frameType; /* backup of the frame type */
00333         phyPIB.frameType = PHY_FRAME_TYPE_BRDC;
00334         ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPacketType_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~( 0x0F ));
00335         ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPacketType_O] |= phyPIB.frameType;
00336         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_TxPacketType_O , ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPacketType_O]);
00337 
00338         DEBUG_PHY("frame type : BRDC\n");
00339 
00340         ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxArq_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~( 1 << NA_TxArq_B ));
00341         NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_TxArq_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxArq_O]);
00342     }
00343 
00344     /* TODO DEBUG REMOVE */
00345     DEBUG_PHY("send : ");
00346     {
00347     uint8_t o;
00348     for (o=0; o<msg->len; o++)
00349     {
00350         DEBUG_PHY("0x%X ", (uint16_t) msg->data[o]);
00351     }
00352     DEBUG_PHY("\n");
00353     }
00354 
00355 
00356     /* TODO DEBUG REMOVE */
00357     DEBUG_PHY("dest MAC : ");
00358     {
00359     uint8_t a;
00360     for (a=0; a<sizeof(AddrT); a++)
00361     {
00362         DEBUG_PHY("0x%X ", (uint16_t) msg->addr[a]);
00363     }
00364     DEBUG_PHY("\n");
00365     }
00366 
00367 
00368     /* packet length max. CONFIG_MAX_PACKET_SIZE byte */
00369     txLen[0] = (uint8_t)((msg->len > CONFIG_MAX_PACKET_SIZE)? CONFIG_MAX_PACKET_SIZE : msg->len);
00370     /* headerbits for identify data or rangingpackets (xxx- ----) */
00371     txLen[1] = (uint8_t)((msg->attribute << 5) & 0xE0 );
00372 
00373     NTRXSPIWrite (NA_RamTxLength_O, txLen, 2);
00374     ntrxState = TxSEND;
00375 
00376     /* reset bit 1,2 */
00377     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_O] &= (uint8_t)( ~( 0x03 << NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_LSB ));
00378 
00379     /* set bit 1,2 with CAMode */
00380     ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_O] |= (uint8_t)(phyPIB.CAMode << NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_LSB);
00381 
00382     /* write to nanoLOC */
00383     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_O, ntrxShadowReg[NA_TxPhCarrSenseMode_O]);
00384 
00385     if (phyPIB.CAMode != PHY_CCA_OFF)
00386     {
00387         DEBUG_PHY("CSMA enabled\n");
00388         phyPIB.titxstart = hwclock();
00389     }
00390 
00391     /* mark buffers as valid and start transmission */
00392     NTRXSPIWriteByte (NA_TxBufferCmd_O, (1 << NA_TxCmdStart_B) | (0x03 << NA_TxBufferCmd_LSB));
00393     TRIGGER_LED_TX();
00394 
00395     txSendMsg = msg;
00396 
00397     do{PHYPoll();}while(ntrxState != TxIDLE);
00398 }
00399 
00400 /**
00401  * @brief This function processes all data request.
00402  * @param *msg this is the message pointer
00403  *
00404  * This function represents the service access point for data requests and
00405  * ranging requests. When the primitive is set to @em PD_DATA_REQUEST all
00406  * necessary actions are taken to copy the payload to the nanoLOC chip
00407  * and set the MAC header parameter in the corresponding registers.
00408  * When all this is done the transmission will be initiated.
00409  * In case of a transmission in progress, @em PDSap will reject the message
00410  * and indicate a failure with the status @em PHY_BUSY_TX.
00411  *
00412  */
00413 /****************************************************************************/
00414 void PDSap (MsgT *msg)
00415 /****************************************************************************/
00416 {
00417 
00418     /* if ntrx is in sleep mode, dont use ntrx */
00419     if (phyPIB.pwrDown == TRUE) return;
00420 
00421     /*
00422      * check the message length. If the message length is bigger than
00423      * the allowed buffer size the packet will be rejected.
00424      */
00425     if (msg->len > CONFIG_MAX_PACKET_SIZE)
00426     {
00427         DEBUG_PHY("packet size > %d\n", CONFIG_MAX_PACKET_SIZE);
00428         msg->prim = PD_DATA_CONFIRM;
00429         msg->status = PHY_INVALID_PARAMETER;
00430         msg->pdu = msg->data;
00431         SendMsgUp (msg);
00432         return;
00433     }
00434 
00435     switch(msg->prim)
00436     {
00437         case PD_DATA_REQUEST :
00438             /* transmitter still busy */
00439             if (txSendMsg != NULL)
00440             {
00441                 DEBUG_PHY("busy tx\n");
00442                 msg->prim = PD_DATA_CONFIRM;
00443                 msg->status = PHY_BUSY_TX;
00444                 msg->pdu = msg->data;
00445                 SendMsgUp (msg);
00446                 return;
00447             }
00448 
00449             if (msg->len == 0)
00450             {
00451                 DEBUG_PHY("packet length <= 0\n");
00452                 msg->prim = PD_DATA_CONFIRM;
00453                 msg->status = PHY_INVALID_PARAMETER;
00454                 msg->pdu = msg->data;
00455                 SendMsgUp (msg);
00456                 return;
00457             }
00458 
00459             msg->attribute = MSG_TYPE_DATA;
00460             NTRXSendPacket(msg);
00461             break;
00462 
00463         case PD_RANGING_REQUEST :
00464 
00465             NTRXRangingRequest(msg);
00466 
00467             break;
00468 
00469         default:
00470             break;
00471     }
00472 }
